title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that diminishing marginal returns begin after the second worker and/or does not explain that the marginal product (MP) of the third worker (30) is less than the MP of the second worker (33).
The response states that diminishing marginal returns begin after the second worker and explains that the marginal product (MP) of the third worker (30) is less than the MP of the second worker (33).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the marginal revenue product of the fourth worker as $125 and/or does not show the work.

The response calculates the marginal revenue product of the fourth worker as $125 and shows the work.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that 6 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 6th worker ($50) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($26), but the MRP of the 7th worker ($25) is less than the MRC ($26).

The response states that 6 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and explains that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 6th worker ($50) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($26), but the MRP of the 7th worker ($25) is less than the MRC ($26).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the market wage will decrease and explains that a decrease in the market demand for travel services will lead to a decrease in demand for travel agents because the demand for travel agents is dependent on (or derived from) the demand for travel services.

· States that the marginal revenue product curve for the firm will shift to the left and explains that the marginal revenue product is the price of the service times the marginal product, so a decrease in the demand for travel services will decrease the price of travel services and will therefore decrease the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the market wage will decrease and explains that a decrease in the market demand for travel services will lead to a decrease in demand for travel agents because the demand for travel agents is dependent on (or derived from) the demand for travel services.

· States that the marginal revenue product curve for the firm will shift to the left and explains that the marginal revenue product is the price of the service times the marginal product, so a decrease in the demand for travel services will decrease the price of travel services and will therefore decrease the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the market wage will decrease and explains that a decrease in the market demand for travel services will lead to a decrease in demand for travel agents because the demand for travel agents is dependent on (or derived from) the demand for travel services.

· States that the marginal revenue product curve for the firm will shift to the left and explains that the marginal revenue product is the price of the service times the marginal product, so a decrease in the demand for travel services will decrease the price of travel services and will therefore decrease the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.
